segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: In a small, roadside inn, most of the way through the Dvalmar Pass headed east. As you and your companions seek answers to the visions seen by the late Occtis Tachonis since reanimated, the Lady of House Royce is curled up in bed next to Thaisha Lloy.
segments.summary: Setting scene at roadside inn in Dvalmar Pass with Lady Aranessa Royce and Thaisha in bed

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Where do we find Julien in this room?
segments.summary: DM asking about Julien's position

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: I think within these comparably tight quarters, Julien has a chair leaning against the door entry to the chamber, and is sitting in it half-resting, half-conscious.
segments.summary: Julien positioned guarding the door

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Elsewhere in the tavern, you hear what sounds like maybe Occtis and Vaelus who, due to very different circumstances, do not need eight hours of rest per night. Thaisha, you wake up slightly as you can feel Aranessa shivering next to you.
segments.summary: Other party members active downstairs, Thaisha wakes to find Aranessa shivering

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I looked down, (chuckles) bad habit. I've absolutely bogarted this blanket, so I'm going to slowly give it back. And I think without trying to do too much magic about it, she's trying to use a little bit of arcane warmth to her hands to try to heat the blanket as she's tucking Aranessa in.
segments.summary: Thaisha uses magic to warm blanket while tucking in Aranessa

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Tucking Aranessa in, your hand passes over her ribs on the side of her chest and you can feel her ribs slightly exposed and realize that you haven't seen Aranessa drink water or eat in a couple days. Her composure has been through the roof. She's been very, very composed. But I think you realize that she's living in a degree of panic that she has not been able to keep anything down or move through the world in any reasonable way. You see that she's struggling, sick.
segments.summary: Thaisha realizes Aranessa hasn't eaten in days and is sick from stress

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I'm going to pop my head up. Do you look, oh, in your-- (grunts) She needs-- (laughs) Fuck! I'm going to try to get out of bed without disrupting her too much more, and pad over to you. She needs to eat.
segments.summary: Thaisha goes to Julien about Aranessa needing food

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: I know she's had some, her mind has been elsewhere but I think, think you are right.
segments.summary: Julien agrees Aranessa needs to eat

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: It's been, I can't imagine what the two of you are going through right now. Both of you. Can I get you anything?

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: Let's get her something to eat, and you can give me something to drink.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Okay, I'm going to clap you on the shoulder with those hands that are just a little too warm, I think, at this point.

segments.content: (groans)

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)

segments.content: Window is locked. Heading downstairs. It's a late hour, but you guys are able to get some food ready at this moment. So there's meat and bread and plenty of potatoes, and things left over from earlier today. You're able to get plates and come upstairs. Julien, not necessarily to your liking, but there is a room temperature dwarven ale here at your disposal.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: I guess... cannot be choosers. I will see if I can muster whatever healthy servings can be amassed for Aranessa, and probably realizes in doing so that I have barely eaten myself and snack a bit, but begin to lean more heavily into the ale when it arrives.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)

segments.content: She puts a potato in her mouth and chews it very slowly. You can see the familiar, it's just the queasiness of fear, of-- it's not something of fear, of-- it's not-- Something in her spine is telling her that at any moment she will have to run for her life and that's not something that tends to make you hungry. She looks up, sensing Julien near the foot of the bed.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She looks up and goes, "When the Royces die, we were told that should we wish it, a golden boat would bear us across a bright river to Faerie. I don't know if that Faerie ferry is still running. Forgive my religious ignorance. Do you think he's already been reborn?"

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yes. There's something I don't talk about very often. I, when I meet someone, usually I get a bit of an idea, an animal that they remind me of. And maybe it's a bit on the nose that Thjazi always reminded me of a falcon, mostly because of that loud screech.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains her ability to see animals in people and describes Thjazi as a falcon

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "He had a really specific laugh."

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Yeah."
segments.summary: Aranessa confirms

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: And it was such a long, ha-- When we first set on the road, I don't think we had been traveling for more than a couple of hours, I heard that loud screech again. And I'd like to think that he's back and he was letting me know that it's okay.
segments.summary: Thaisha believes she heard Thjazi's spirit early in their journey

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: My lady. If the boats are not ready then we will endure until those doors open again. And to endure, we must eat. We must have our strength for you to rise and for me to punish, whatever it takes. And he slowly reaches out and takes another piece of that potato. Studies it a moment, puts it in his mouth and slowly chews the flavorless morsel.

segments.content: You get into the bed, and you see Lady Aranessa looks at you on the other side of the bed, and goes,

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I wouldn't be frightened to look for that golden boat if you were by my side, Julien."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "To strength, and I suppose punishment." And she closes her eyes.

However, perhaps the earl is already in communication with the House of Halovar, and this is all cloak and dagger and above the knowledge or foresight of a humble knight. So I will take this wealth that you have given. I'll share it amongst my brother knights, all of whom were made the same promises. And that would be at least several weeks of service to the Barony of Sloak and whatever it should call for. But you have asked for time, sir."

segments.content: But no, I'd be here anyways. Well, I don't give a shit about the House of Halovar. I'm here to help you. And I don't like my family either. We're here. I mean, it seems like you guys have noble aspirations.

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: No, we can try, but I just don't-- So many people saw us here. I don't think it's going to happen.

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: Does it make you uncomfortable to be subversive, especially if your family are liars?

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: Well, I'm not a liar.

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: This is true from what I've seen. But does it make you uncomfortable?

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: Then you will have to decide if you are going to play the game that they are playing or if you will do your own thing.

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: Has no one ever been truly grateful to you before? You say you're a servant of the Light and you want to do well for others. You've never helped someone out of the goodness of your heart--

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: Of course.

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: -- and felt real gratitude.

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: Of course, we've helped many people.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Do you know the difference between fear and gratitude?

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: That's a good question.

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: I thought I did. But everyone we've met along this journey so far has just been scared of me or my family, so I can't tell anymore.

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: Right now the castle's yours, and the choice is yours.

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: Well, then let's just do a good thing that we know is good and whether they're grateful or not and whether they keep our secret or not, that's up to them.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Yes, Your Radiance.

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: Yes, Baron.

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: Fuck yeah.

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: I'll work on you. Who do I bequeath it to? All of them?

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: I think the last knight of the Order of the Howling Rain might be a good target.

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: The Dame?

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: She's local.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You turn around from this hushed conversation and you can see all of them are doing this thing that you recognize. I think you immediately recognize this, Teor and Kattigan and Thimble as well, that all of them have packs full of stuff and all of them have one side that they have put on and are sitting on top of them and they're well packed, immediately become a chair--
segments.summary: The knights have efficiently set up a makeshift camp using their packs as chairs

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: Oh yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: -- needed. You know, like, (whumps) And seated, you see that a couple of them take their shields and put them on the ground, and four of those stacked up makes a little table, and are breaking bread on it. I think you see a natural, as you take a look at her, you see that younger though she is, she looks like she's maybe in her mid to late 30s, which means that she would not have been old enough to have fought in the War of Axe and Vine. Someone said she went and fought in the Falconer's Rebellion herself. I think Thimble, you put the age together and go, "Oh," she's like, "I'm not missing another one." You know, like, "I was too young."
segments.summary: Dame Cosgrove is observed to be in her 30s, too young for the War of Axe and Vine but old enough for the Falconer's Rebellion

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And so you see that she is smiling and has an ease. The people that are here all look to her for providing answers of some kind. Just see her have a natural ease of something that people like Casimir Gavendale or Gully Breeches will never understand, which is people look for leadership in the people that are looking to them with trust and a sense of being there for them. Leadership is an act. It's of support in and of itself. And you see her here supporting all of these people that are around her.
segments.summary: Dame Cosgrove displays natural leadership through trust and support, contrasting with nobles like Casimir

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: Dame Cosgrove, is it?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Yes, my Lord." She stands up in attention.

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: A decision has been made. After conferring with my parliament-- we have decided that we are going to vacate this castle and be on our merry way. But in doing so, we would like to bequeath it to you and present you with the deed to this place. Trusting in you to take care of it as you see fit. To share it with whom you see fit. And to make it a place, hopefully, that does good for this community and for your own name. And as the last knight of the-- What was it again?
segments.summary: Wicander officially bequeaths Castle Sloak to Dame Cosgrove

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: ook like they've just been working. She has these crazy forearms. Looks like she's kneading dough or cutting stuff all day. You see she walks out and goes, "Oh! Well, welcome to Brauwla's. It's a strange thing we've--" You see she looks out and says, "Well! One moment please." She pulls out a little stool, goes over and takes an iron nail out from over her doorstep and says, "Come right in, milady."
segments.summary: Brauwla welcomes the party to her public house after removing an iron nail

segments.speaker: Robbie Daymond
segments.content: Aww!

segments.speaker: Whitney Moore
segments.content: Aww!

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Thank you so much. I don't know if that would've done anything, to be honest, but I appreciate you.
segments.summary: Tyranny thanks Brauwla for removing the iron nail

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I hope it would've done something."
segments.summary: Brauwla responds to Tyranny's comment about the iron nail

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She comes up and says, "Well, you're at Sloak's only public house. So we've only bread and a potato soup."
segments.summary: Brauwla describes the limited menu at her establishment

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "That's it."
segments.summary: Brauwla emphasizes the simplicity of her menu

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Potato soup sounds delicious.
segments.summary: Thimble expresses interest in the potato soup

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Do you have any beer?
segments.summary: Tyranny asks about beer availability

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "No."
segments.summary: Brauwla confirms they don't have beer

segments.speaker: Whitney Moore
segments.content: Oh.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: (laughs) Only bread!

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: There's wine at-- How long is the walk back to the castle? Because there's wine there.
segments.summary: Tyranny inquires about returning to the castle for wine

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: To the castle?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: It's not our castle.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: They'll give us wine.
segments.summary: Tyranny believes they can get wine at the castle

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She says, "I've sent my husband out to the King's Way to get some ale but he walks slower than he used to."
segments.summary: Brauwla explains her husband went to get ale but is slow

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Okay, great.
segments.summary: Tyranny responds to Brauwla's explanation

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Probably another day or so, I'd say."
segments.summary: Brauwla estimates when her husband will return with ale

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: I just would love to have a cocktail right now. You know, it's fine. Listen, you're going to start making your own rules. So that means you can have a little drinky-poo with your old girl, Tyr. But we'll get to that at some point, I'm sure.
segments.summary: Tyranny muses about wanting a cocktail and making rules

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you guys are in here, you hear a familiar voice behind you say, "As I live and breathe."
segments.summary: A familiar voice addresses the party from behind

segments.speaker: Robbie Daymond
segments.content: Oh!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see walking in is Dame Morgaine, who comes in from the little hound shrine and she says, "My friends."
segments.summary: Dame Morgaine enters from the hound shrine and greets the party

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Dame.
segments.summary: Thimble greets Dame Morgaine

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I understand that it's been an eventful day in Sloak."
segments.summary: Dame Morgaine acknowledges the eventful day in Sloak

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Did you hear everything?
segments.summary: Thimble asks if Dame Morgaine heard about the events

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Not what occurred up in the castle. My business brought me to the town. I was speaking with young master Jasper." She looks over, and you can see over in a corner are a group of really sad looking dwarves who all have tankards full of water.
segments.summary: Dame Morgaine explains she was speaking with Jasper and gestures to sad dwarves drinking water

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see Jasper.
segments.summary: The party notices Jasper in the corner

segments.speaker: Robbie Daymond
segments.content: This is a dry county.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: There's this one dwarf who's got a thick red beard that comes down that you can see is braided and his red beard is dyed with strands of black and white that go in throughout it. So it's tied up into this thing. You see he looks out and goes, "Fellas, I'm really sorry. I'm really sorry."
segments.summary: A dwarf with a distinctive braided beard apologizes to his companions

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: "I don't think this is light beer."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Morgaine says, "But I understand there's been a changing of the guard here?"
segments.summary: Dame Morgaine asks about leadership changes in Sloak

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Indeed.
segments.summary: Teor confirms the leadership change

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Dame Morgaine is in dog form, correct?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She is a dog. She's looking at you, she's this herding dog.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: She is a dog.

segments.speaker: Laura Bailey
segments.content: She is a dog.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: No one in the place seems to blink an eye at this?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: No one is blinking an eye at this.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Okay, okay.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As she walks in, she looks in and says, "Well, Casimir Gavendale is no more and you are now the Lord of--"
segments.summary: Dame Morgaine mentions Casimir's death and assumes someone is the new lord

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: No, no. I am not. That honor belongs to Dame Cosgrove and we have--
segments.summary: Wicander corrects Dame Morgaine about the lordship

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Baroness.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: The Baroness.
segments.summary: Wicander corrects the title to Baroness

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She raises her eyebrows. "You've seen fit to offer the title of Castle Sloak to, who is this?" She looks over, and you see that Winifred gets down on a knee and says, "My lady knight, it is an honor," and bows and you see that Morgaine cocks her head to the side and puts two paws up on her chest and she whispers into her ear and goes, (Morgaine) "No, no. You are my sister. We do not bow as this to each other. (lick of affection)"
segments.summary: Dame Morgaine questions the title transfer and has an affectionate interaction with Winifred

segments.speaker: Whitney Moore
segments.content: Cute.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She turns and says, "Well, Baroness Sloak, we must speak, you and I." She says (Winifred) "Yes, I have the deed here." She looks over at the deed and she says, (Morgaine) "My word. Well, this is stunningly official looking." She says, (Winifred) "We make envoy for Tybry's Lea and the Earl." Morgaine cocks her head and says, "Or perhaps, we can wait for His Majesty to return and he can affirm this deed of title on his return from Dol-Makjar."
segments.summary: Dame Morgaine and Winifred discuss the deed and waiting for royal confirmation

segments.speaker: Robbie Daymond
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She looks up at you guys, Dame Morgaine, and nods and says, "This is quite a salvaged state of affairs from what seemed this morning quite bleak. Are there any other loose ends?"
segments.summary: Dame Morgaine commends the improved situation and asks about remaining issues

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yes. Talcydimir, the lion folk.
segments.summary: Thimble mentions Talcydimir as a loose end

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Yes."
segments.summary: Dame Morgaine acknowledges Talcydimir

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: He was no longer with the Tachonis when they arrived at the castle.
segments.summary: Thimble explains Talcydimir's absence from the Tachonis group
